intro: Dimeria keralae, commonly known as the Kerala dimeria, is a flowering plant species native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, herbaceous growth habit. The plant typically features simple, alternate leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers with four petals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
